title: Team_MegaPari
author: Team_MegaPari
content: Hey guys! Some of us are occupied in i-Gaming industry, some are just players...but apart from leisure&profession there are still old good offline casinos all around the world.Today Im thinking if visiting an offline casino is out of date or still a good place to visit while travelling? Do you visit casinos when you travel? How often? Which ones? Let's remember of old good times

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: I prefer the online ones, I may not consider land based casinos. I also travel on purpose, I may not have time for land based casinos during that time being the reason. Maybe during tourism, I may not consider that because I like to be extra careful while being on a foreign land. Some people gamble on land based casinos very well, not yet the thing of the past, but people are more exposed to gambling with the online casinos, it makes gambling easier done as you can play on your phone at anytime.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: there is no such thing as "out of date"(at least for me) when visiting a land-based casino when travelling and to be honest, visiting casinos when travelling is a great way to enjoy your travel/time(of course as long as you only gamble what you can afford to lose). I rarely travel but there are times when visiting family or relatives, we do make a plan on going to a casino that is near the area and have a good time.

comments.author: theskillzdatklls
comments.body: It's lower on my list of things I'd do, but far from impossible. Depends on the status/quality of the local casino and how cool the local things are going on in an area.Also importantly whether or not poker is spread in the casino.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: Quote from: Team_MegaPari on October 12, 2022, 11:04:16 AMLet's remember of old good times  For players in some countries where gambling is legal, of course, it's fun to play at offline casinos. met other gamblers, in a fairly crowded atmosphere. of course with a glass of wine and pretty girls there. it's like a scene in a movie  for me living in a country where gambling is prohibited. Of course, online casinos are the best. we can gamble without our neighbors and relatives knowing. don't care about them I just have fun at the casino and earn money.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: Depending on who I'm traveling with, if I'm with friends and also like traditional casinos I'll try to visit and before I ask about casino rules.and I just want to know the local casino where we vacation and have fun with drinks, because I already feel comfortable and safe playing online casino because it doesn't cost extra and can be played anytime and anywhere when I want to bet.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Yes, it's still a preferred thing to do and good place to visit if you're visiting places offshore. You can just test out a few bucks and then see where it's going.If you have time to allocate and visit those casinos in the country where you're going then it's up to your availability.Since the pandemic, I can no longer travel freely anymore. But if given the chance, I'd like to visit them, the closest to the port or airport if I travel.

Do you visit casinos when you travel? How often? Which ones? Let's remember of old good times  I don't remember good old times from these offline casinos,they are rigid in the form that they cannot offer you the same number of slot machines available in online casinos from all the great providers we have and their game play mechanics of most of their slots is old and outdated to say the least.Some of them still use Admiral games or Apex or any other provider which are not that well known compared to our greatest providers like Play n Go,Pragmatic Play,Hacksaw gaming,No limit city and Relax gaming to name a few.Based on this I am not at all tempted to go and visit them because I have everything I need in my mobile phone nowadays and that is the great thing about technology,it empowers and makes our life easier.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: I have a very bad experience on doing such thing. I experience a terrible loss while gambling during my trip since I can’t focus on gambling while sightseeing with my family. I made a couple of bad decisions and greedy bets. In the end, I was so frustrated during my whole trip because I keep thinking about my loss and I can’t focus on my vacation. Gambling while traveling is a bad idea because it can kill the mood if your purpose of travel is to have fun. Much better to gamble when you have time to focus and your mind is not occupied by other things.

comments.author: Peanutswar
comments.body: Mostly when I have a game bet with I always visit the gambling casino to check the odds happen in the upcoming event and it is good too to make a decision before game starts we have a chance, upon with the slot games i rarely play while travelling because it is hard to check if I win already and it's too hard to focus it is better to play when you think it is ready yourself there's a chance that you might affect your emotion during playing and while traveling.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: For me, I think it depends on how the individual in question take gambling, some people take gambling as their profession/career, while some others see it as a way of being social and having fun.For those who take gambling as their profession/career, its very understandable if we see such persons visiting casinos while traveling, but for those who consider gambling as a way of meeting people and having fun, their reason for traveling will determine whether they visit a casino or not, if the person is on a very important trip, I personally assume such individual will even have time to gamble.

Let's remember of old good times  Mostly not because for traveling I make sure that I am away from other things that can cause me stress and casino is one of that. I prefer to be peaceful at the beach and disconnect to other disturbing matter since I want to be at piece. But if you prefer to gamble on your vacation then its your choice since at the end of the day you are the one who can define what things you can enjoy and which is not.

comments.author: Ryker1

But most of the time when I was in travel, I did not visit gambling casinos because I enjoyed those tourist places that commonly visit. Perhaps for me --Las Vegas is a nice place to visit when it comes to gambling casinos and I want to see a decent gambling room in any place abroad. However, online gambling casinos or i-games gambling industry is now very popular, so why I will spend time going to offline casino if they are the same and it is not popular the same Las Vegas?

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: If I travelled on where the country has an offline casino, I would try to gamble and see if I'm lucky on that's country. Las Vegas is a dream of many gamblers in this world since it's a completely free town that we can do anything on there. I will gamble, then take many drink and then have a sex on there IMO offline casino is better than online casino since there's many thing that we wouldn't feel if we play on online casino.

comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: This is not my case. I gamble very little, just online (I went a couple of times to a Bingo in my city and it was nice, but they closed), so when travelling abroad I have been more interested in other entertainments, and I never thought about visiting casinos before.But I suppose that, taking into account the trend to virtualise everything, long time ago established casinos will be more and more a rarity in this world, so the next time I visit foreign cities I will consider visiting them, as something cultural more than to gamble my money there. Maybe to take a shot and see how others play. Nothing to say if I ever visit Las Vegas or Montecarlo.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Team_MegaPari on October 12, 2022, 11:04:16 AMDo you visit casinos when you travel? How often? Which ones? You mean the casino visited is a real/physical casino operating in a building/apartment/residential......!If that's what you mean, before the pandemic I used to visit often, but not recently, my country is currently in chaos. Residential casinos are not convenient to visit, Since the arrest of one of the governors in one of the provinces of my country, that's when many casinos are uncomfortable to visit.Before any action from the authorities carrying out routine raids, I used to often visit the casino located in the Robinson Apartments, I love visiting the casino there, if I go there it's like I am in Las Vegas, the casino there only operates three days a week, friday, saturday and sunday now i don't know anymore, risk.Although at this time there are still casinos that are comfortable to visit when traveling, but I'm a little tired of visiting there, I'm happier now betting and playing on online gambling sites rather than offline.

Let's remember of old good times  I am not someone for whom it is necessary to visit an offline casino even with such an opportunity, it's just that this whole situation just repels me, I just prefer online gambling so it's calmer and more practical.

comments.author: Mauser
comments.body: Quote from: Team_MegaPari on October 12, 2022, 11:04:16 AMToday Im thinking if visiting an offline casino is out of date or still a good place to visit while travelling? Do you visit casinos when you travel? How often? Which ones? Let's remember of old good times  For me it's a definite yes. When I am travelling with friends and there is a fancy casino in the city we are in, we will definitely go there one evening and spend some money. Physical casinos have a great atmosphere and flair, that makes a good night out. Even when you only gamble a little it can still be fun to visit a casino. Usually there is very good food and affordable drinks in a casino and you can watch other gamblers play. It's been some time since I went to a casino during a vacation trip because of the covid pandemic. Before covid I used to travel one time per year to Prague or Amsterdam with 2 good friends and part of that trip was always to go to a local casino. A vacation trip is not a bad idea in general, because they usually have great hotels that are much cheaper than usually. If everything goes well I might be able to go to Macau next year, it's one of my dreams for a long time.
